column2: Fact Check: Will you be penalised for ‘giving lift’ to unknown persons?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Will you be penalised for ‘giving lift’ to unknown persons?

column2: Fact Check: Did Manmohan Singh undertake more foreign visits than Narendra Modi?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Did Manmohan Singh undertake more foreign visits than Narendra Modi?

column2: Claim: 31.52 crore Jan Dhan accounts have been opened, equivalent to the population of USA.
column5: Fact: A total of 32.99 crore accounts have been opened under PMJDY till date. The latest population of the USA is 32.88 crores. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on Jan Suraksha

column2: Claim:  More than 1 crore income tax payers linked their Aadhaar with PAN.
column5: Fact: Since it has been made mandatory, more than 16.84 crore PANs have been linked to Aadhaar but how many of them are paying tax cannot be verified. Hence, the claim is UNVERIFIED.
column10: Fact Checking government claims over use of Technology

column2: Claim: Access audit of 1662 important buildings in 50 cities has been completed till date.
column5: Fact: Access audits of 1662 buildings in 50 cities completed by auditors. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Check: Has Accessibility for PwDs improved in the last four years?

column2: Claim: Online application made mandatory for all clearances
column5: Fact: It is TRUE that all project proponents have to now make online applications for environmental & forest clearance.
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s claims on Auctions & Clearances

column2: Claim: Provided for penalties for offences committed against persons with disabilities (PwDs)
column5: Fact: Chapter 16 of the Rights of persons with disabilities Act, 2016 provides for the penalties. Hence, the claim is TRUE.  However,It has to be noted that penalties were also part of the original bill introduced by the UPA government in 2014.
column10: Fact Checking Government Claims on the ‘Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act’

column2: Claim: Right to free education for children with disabilities (6-18yrs) and reservation of 4% seats for students in higher education institutions.
column5: Fact: Right to free education is provided for children in the 6-18 age group & reservation of not less than 5% is provided in higher educational institutions for those with benchmark disabilities, but not to everyone with a disability. Hence, the claim is PARTLY TRUE. Again, it has to be noted that both these provisions were also part of the original bill introduced by the UPA in 2014.
column10: Fact Checking Government Claims on the ‘Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act’

column2: Claim: Converting at least 50% of all the government buildings in the national capital and all state capitals fully accessible.
column5: Fact: 58 out of the 75 selected central government buildings in 39 cities have been retrofitted as of March 2018. Since the claim is talking about a future target and not an achievement, it remains UNVERIFIED
column10: Fact Check: Has Accessibility for PwDs improved in the last four years?

column2: Claim: Over 6 lakh Divyang people have benefitted from 5790 camps.
column5: Fact: In the last 4 years, 6073 camps were organized which have benefitted 9.35 lakh people.  Hence, the claim is TRUE.  However, it has to be noted that the average number of beneficiaries under the ADIP scheme has not increased despite a substantial increase in the number of camps. Even under the UPA, the annual average number of beneficiaries was around 2.5 lakh.
column10: Fact Check: What did the government do for the development of Persons with Disabilities?

column2: Claim: FDI equity flow has gone up by 47%.
column5: Fact: The claim is very vague and the available data does not corroborate this number. Hence the claim is FALSE.
column10: Fact Check: Has India attracted more FDI in the last few years?

column2: Claim: Income eligibility has been raised from 2 lakh rupees to 2.5 lakh rupees for the pre-metric scholarship for SC students.
column5: Fact: Income eligibility criteria for Pre-Matric Scholarships for Scheduled Castes Students studying in Class IX and X was raised from Rs. 2 Lakh to Rs. 2.5 Lakh. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Check: Has the allocation for Scholarships of SCs/OBCs increased?

column2: Claim: More than 1 crore taxpayers registered with GST, including 35 lakh new taxpayers.
column5: Fact: As of December 2017, close to 1 crore taxpayers were registered under GST out of which 34.22 lakh were new. Hence the claim is TRUE
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s Claims over formalization of Economy

column2: Claim: India ranked 3rd in the list of top prospective host economies for 2016-18 in the UNCTAD World Investment Report (WIR).
column5: Fact:  India continues to be ranked 3rd in the list of prospective economies in WIR. This ranking has been more or less stable for a number of years. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking claims on India’s global standing in FDI inflows

column2: Claim: There has been a rise from 36.05 billion USD in 2013-14 to 60.08 billion USD in 2016-17
column5: Fact: Assuming that the numbers correspond to India’s Gross Foreign Direct Investment, the claim is TRUE. However, India’s net FDI inflows and the FDI to GDP ratio have decreased in the last two years
column10: Fact Check: Has India attracted more FDI in the last few years?

column2: Fact Check: Has the UP Government slashed funds for Education?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Has the UP Government slashed funds for Education?

column2: Claim: Special camps have been organized for distribution of aids and assistive devices to 8 lakh persons with disabilities.
column5: Fact: 275 Mega Camps/Special Camps were organized benefitting 3.01 lakh Divyangjans during the last four years. The total number of beneficiaries of the ADIP program in the last four years is more than 9 lakh, but the number of beneficiaries of special camps is only 3.01 lakh. Hence, the claim is FALSE. It also has to be noted that the average number of beneficiaries per year under this scheme during the UPA was also around 2.5 lakh, which has not changed during the current government.
column10: Fact Check: Has Accessibility for PwDs improved in the last four years?

column2: Claim: Government has abolished interviews for non-gazetted posts
column5: Fact: Government has dispensed interview for all group C and non-gazetted posts of group B category in the central government. Hence, the claim is TRUE
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s claims on Auctions & Clearances

column2: Claim: The number of ITRs filed during FY 2017-18 is 6.84 crore, a jump of 80.5% compared to FY 2013-14.
column5: Fact: The number of ITRs filed have increased substantially over the last 4 financial years from 3.79 crores to 6.84 crores. Hence, the claim is TRUE. But the total direct tax collections have not increased proportionately.
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s Claims over formalization of Economy

column2: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi’s Claims in Telangana public meeting
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi’s Claims in Telangana public meeting

column2: Claim: Income eligibility has been raised from 44,500 rupees to 2.5 lakh rupees for the pre-metric scholarship for OBCs.
column5: Fact: The income eligibility has indeed been raised from Rs. 44,500 in 2016-17 to Rs. 2,50,000 in 2017-18. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Check: Has the allocation for Scholarships of SCs/OBCs increased?

column2: Fact Check: Is India’s 30 place jump in 2018 EODB rankings the best ever?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Is India’s 30 place jump in 2018 EODB rankings the best ever?

column2: Claim: Over 3.3 crore students benefitted during 2014-16, with scholarships worth Rs. 7565 crore.
column5: Fact: The total number of beneficiaries during 2014-16 is 6.99 crore and the total amount of central assistance released is Rs. 7050.22 crore. Both the number of beneficiaries & the amount of central assistance hasn’t changed much from the last two years of the UPA government.
column10: Fact Check: Has the allocation for Scholarships of SCs/OBCs increased?

column2: Claim: A bank account has been created for every family in just four years.
column5: Fact: 32.99 crore accounts have been opened under PMJDY but it is not possible to verify if each & every family has a bank account. Hence, the claim remains UNVERIFIED.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on Jan Suraksha

column2: Claim: Unprecedented increase in camps for Divyangs (PwDs)
column5: Fact: There has been a 40% increase in the average number of camps conducted for PwDs under the ADIP scheme. Hence the claim is TRUE
column10: Fact Check: What did the government do for the development of Persons with Disabilities?

column2: Claim: Only 55 camps were conducted pre 2014 for distribution of support equipment to Divyangs while more than 6000 camps are conducted post 2014.
column5: Fact: It is true that more than 6000 camps were conducted for PwDs under the ADIP scheme since 2014-15. But, it is false that only 55 camps were conducted pre 2014. Hence the claim is FALSE.
column10: Fact Check: Has there been a exponential increase in camps for Divyangs?

column2: Claim: The time taken for environmental approvals has been brought down to 180 days from 600 days.
column5: Fact: The time taken for environmental approvals was 600 days prior to 2014 and it was 177 days in 2017. Hence, the claim is TRUE. The reduction in time taken could be because of multiple reasons like changes in process etc.
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s claims on Auctions & Clearances

column2: Claim: 50 lakh new bank accounts opened for cashless, transparent transfer of wages, benefitting workers.
column5: Fact: The claim is unclear and hence, UNVERIFIED
column10: Fact Checking the Government’s Claims over formalization of Economy

column2: Fact Check: Has the Pew research said that 85% Indians trust the Government?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Has the Pew research said that 85% Indians trust the Government?

column2: Claim: Stipend has been raised from ₹1500 to ₹2500 for local students and from ₹3000 to ₹5000 for outstation students.
column5: Fact: Stipend has been raised from  ₹1500 to ₹2500 for local students and from ₹3000 to ₹5000 per month for outstation students. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on increase in Scholarship amount to SCs & OBCs

column2: Fact Check: Have Amendments to SC/ST PoA worked on ground?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Have Amendments to SC/ST PoA worked on ground?

column2: Claim: Free coaching for SC and OBC students, income eligibility raised from ₹4.5 lakhs to ₹6 lakh rupees
column5: Fact: For Free coaching for SC and OBC students, the income eligibility has been raised from  ₹4.5 lakhs to ₹6 lakhs. This revision was made in 2016. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on increase in Scholarship amount to SCs & OBCs

column2: Fact Check: Delhi Class XII results & how Manish Sisodia got it wrong
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Delhi Class XII results & how Manish Sisodia got it wrong

column2: Claim: Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC) established.
column5: Fact: ISLRTC was first established as an autonomous center in IGNOU in 2011 which was later closed down. It was established as an independent society in  2015 by the current government. Hence, the claim is only PARTLY TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on Scholarship to Persons with Disability

column2: Fact Check: Did Japan & USA enforce temperature setting of Air Conditioners?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Did Japan & USA enforce temperature setting of Air Conditioners?

column2: Fact Check: Has the Government reduced over 60% budget for RTI?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Has the Government reduced over 60% budget for RTI?

column2: Claim: Reservations for Divyang persons in government jobs have been raised from 3% to 4%.
column5: Fact: The change in the law governing the rights of people with disabilities has led to an increase in reservation in government jobs from 3% to 4% for persons with benchmark disabilities. In that sense, the claim is PARTLY TRUE since the reservation is only for persons with benchmark disabilities. But, it has to be noted that the draft bill of the new law which was introduced in the parliament by the UPA in 2014 provided for 5% reservation.
column10: Fact Check: What did the government do for the development of Persons with Disabilities?

column2: Fact Check: In whose tenure did ‘Exports’ grow faster?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: In whose tenure did ‘Exports’ grow faster?

column2: Claim: GEM online platform for government procurement from vendors to reduce corruption and increase transparency
column5: Fact: The platform has been made operational. The contribution of the platform to reducing corruption and increasing transparency cannot be verified. Hence, the claim is UNVERIFIED.
column10: Fact Checking government claims over use of Technology

column2: Fact Check: Did PM Modi inaugurate an already open ‘All India Institute of Ayurveda’?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Did PM Modi inaugurate an already open ‘All India Institute of Ayurveda’?

column2: Fact Check: Are Padma Awardees accorded a ‘State Funeral’?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Are Padma Awardees accorded a ‘State Funeral’?

column2: Claim: Stipend for day scholars has been raised from ₹150 to ₹225 and for hostellers from ₹350  to ₹525.
column5: Fact: Revision of maintenance allowance for Day Scholars from ₹150 per month to ₹225 per month and for Hostellers from ₹350 per month to ₹ 525 per month was done in September 2017. Hence this claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on increase in Scholarship amount to SCs & OBCs

column2: Fact Check: Is there a 3-minute waiting rule at Toll Plazas on National Highways?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Is there a 3-minute waiting rule at Toll Plazas on National Highways?

column2: Claim: Over 3,65,996 crores rupees have been directly transferred into the bank accounts of beneficiaries for 432 schemes in last 4 years.
column5: Fact: More than Rs 4.6 lakh crore have been transferred into the accounts of people availing 464 schemes and services from 57 different ministries. Hence, the claim is TRUE. But it has to be noted that the DBT initiative was started during the UPA-2 government.
column10: Fact Checking government claims over use of Technology

column2: Claim: India is the world number one in attracting Greenfield FDI.
column5: Fact: As per the fDi intelligence, India was the highest ranked country in attracting Greenfield FDI in 2015 & 2016. However, in 2017, India was replaced by USA for the top spot. Hence the claim is only PARTLY TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking claims on India’s global standing in FDI inflows

column2: Fact Check: Have deposits by Indians in Swiss Banks decreased?
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: Have deposits by Indians in Swiss Banks decreased?

column2: Fact Check: India’s standing in Global Indices
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: India’s standing in Global Indices

column2: Claim: For pre-matric scholarship for OBCs, the rates of scholarship increased substantially.
column5: Fact: The rates have been doubled in certain cases and more than doubled in other cases. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on increase in Scholarship amount to SCs & OBCs

column2: Claim: The previous UPA government constructed only 25 lakh houses in their last 4 years where as the current government in the last 4 years constructed 1.25 crore houses, a difference of 1 crore houses.
column5: Fact: The UPA in its last 4 years constructed 89.65 lakh houses and not 25 lakh houses. Hence the claim is FALSE.
column10: Fact Check: Did the UPA construct only 25 lakh houses in their last 4 years?

column2: Claim: Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan has been launched by the government on 3rd December 2015 to provide dignity to divyangs.
column5: Fact: Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan is the same as the accessible India campaign. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Check: Has Accessibility for PwDs improved in the last four years?

column2: Fact Check: How the media misinterpreted & misreported the PM’s statements on Passports
column5: Fact: The claim is TRUE as mentioned above.
column10: Fact Check: How the media misinterpreted & misreported the PM’s statements on Passports

column2: Claim: Modi government paid interest of Rs 40,000 crore on oil bonds.
column5: Fact: The Modi government paid Rs 40,225 crore on interest for oil bonds. Hence this claim is TRUE. But it has to be noted that even the previous UPA government paid such interest and in fact a greater amount than the current government.
column10: Fact Check: How much did the Modi Government pay for the UPA era oil bonds?

column2: Fact Check: News about Government Compensation in case of Accident Deaths is False
column5: None
column10: Fact Check: News about Government Compensation in case of Accident Deaths is False

column2: Claim: 644 out of the 709 railway stations have been provided with accessibility features for persons with disabilities.
column5: Fact: Out of 709 A1, A & B category railway stations, 653 are made accessible in short term features. The claim does not mention that 709 is only the number of A1, A and B category stations and not all railway stations. The claim also does not mention that these stations were made accessible with short term features and a lesser number with long-term features. However, the numbers are right. Hence, the claim is PARTLY TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government Claims on Accessibility for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs)

column2: Claim: Modi government paid off the pending bills of the Oil Bonds.
column5: Fact: The Modi government paid only Rs 3,500 crore worth oil bonds which matured in 2015 and Oil Bonds worth Rs 1.3 lakh crore are still pending. Hence this claim is FALSE.
column10: Fact Check: How much did the Modi Government pay for the UPA era oil bonds?

column2: Claim: Moody’s upgraded India sovereign credit rating from Baa3 to Baa2 for the first time in 14 years.
column5: Fact: Moody’s Investors Service has upgraded the Government of India’s local and foreign currency issuer ratings to Baa2 from Baa3. India’s rating has been upgraded after a period of 13 years. Hence the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking claims on India’s global standing in FDI inflows

column2: Claim: India ranked 9th on the foreign direct investment (FDI) inflows in 2016 – World Investment Report 2017.
column5: Fact: It is true that India is ranked 9th in the list for 2016. However, FDI inflows decreased in the 2017 and India slipped to the 10th rank in 2017. Hence the claim is PARTLY TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking claims on India’s global standing in FDI inflows
